pull.title: build: bitcoin_qt.m4 fixes and improvements
pull.body:
**Part A**

There are two occurrences of AC_DEFINE(QT_STATICPLUGIN...) macro:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/b931f61b9ab098ea4ea8fbe4cbf0b03c566c3f63/build-aux/m4/bitcoin_qt.m4#L320-L322

and

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/b931f61b9ab098ea4ea8fbe4cbf0b03c566c3f63/build-aux/m4/bitcoin_qt.m4#L115-L118

The former could be removed safely.

**Part B** (from #17836)

It is expected that `--with-gui` behaves the same as `--with-gui=auto`.

But if Qt dependencies not found, `configure --with-gui` fails rather than warns. See: #17813 

Ref: **laanwj**'s [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6938#issuecomment-153757477) from #6938

This PR fixes #17813 

**Part C** (from #17837)

This PR removes code that repeats three times.
Also currently on master (8830cb58abc888144a1edb9b2fba427716cc45d8) some parts are brittle:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/8830cb58abc888144a1edb9b2fba427716cc45d8/build-aux/m4/bitcoin_qt.m4#L290

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/8830cb58abc888144a1edb9b2fba427716cc45d8/build-aux/m4/bitcoin_qt.m4#L387

---

Other small improvements:
- "qt" -> "Qt" in messages and comments
-  fixed m4 escaping
- fixed a warning:
```
$ cat config.log | grep -A 2 'extra tokens'
conftest.cpp:76:28: warning: extra tokens at end of #ifndef directive
         #ifndef QT_VERSION OR QT_VERSION_STR
                            ^~
```

QT_STATICPLUGIN is set in BITCOIN_QT_CONFIGURE macro.

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18297 (build: Use pkg-config in BITCOIN_QT_CONFIGURE for all hosts including Windows by hebasto)
* #15706 (build: Check QT library version by lucayepa)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1577742283 +0200
committer Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1577754303 +0200

build: Fix --with-gui configure option without arg

Now --with-gui without argument behaves the same as --with-gui=auto, 
i.e., if Qt is unavailable, it rather warns than fails.

events.message:
build: Fix --with-gui configure option without arg

Now --with-gui without argument behaves the same as --with-gui=auto, 
i.e., if Qt is unavailable, it rather warns than fails.
